intro: Cynophalla amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a waxy texture, and it produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
